div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 119 Leucas, Acarnania, c. 1925 (617) Burial: c. 300 B.C.? (T) Contents: 49+ AR Syracuse: 1 one-and-one-half-litrae Anactorium: 1 triob. Leucas: 1 dr.; 1 triob.; 3 smaller fr. Corinth: 21 dr., 1 trihemidr.; 11 triob.; 8 smaller fr. Unc. mint: 1 dr. Disposition: Yale 49 Bellinger, YCS 2 (1931), pp. 187-98, illus. Probably a mixture of two hds. Staters of Corinth and colonies comprised the bulk of the lot seen by Bellinger
